Toggle Menu

salt.modules.rvm

Manage ruby installations and gemsets with RVM, the Ruby Version Manager.

do

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.do(
								ruby,
								command,
								runas=None,
								cwd=None
								)

Execute a command in an RVM controlled environment.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby:

The ruby to use.
command:

The command to execute.
runas

The user to run rvm as.
cwd

The current working directory.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.do 2.0.0 <command>

gemset_copy

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.gemset_copy(
								source,
								destination,
								runas=None
								)

Copy all gems from one gemset to another.

Arguments

Name Description
source

The name of the gemset to copy, complete with ruby version.
destination

The destination gemset.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.gemset_copy foobar bazquo

gemset_create

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.gemset_create(
								ruby,
								gemset,
								runas=None
								)

Creates a gemset.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The ruby version to create the gemset for.
gemset

The name of the gemset to create.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.gemset_create 2.0.0 foobar

gemset_delete

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.gemset_delete(
								ruby,
								gemset,
								runas=None
								)

Deletes a gemset.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The ruby version the gemset belongs to.
gemset

The gemset to delete.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.gemset_delete 2.0.0 foobar

gemset_empty

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.gemset_empty(
								ruby,
								gemset,
								runas=None
								)

Remove all gems from a gemset.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The ruby version the gemset belongs to.
gemset

The gemset to empty.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.gemset_empty 2.0.0 foobar

gemset_list

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.gemset_list(
								ruby='default',
								runas=None
								)

List all gemsets for the given ruby.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The ruby version to list the gemsets for
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.gemset_list

gemset_list_all

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.gemset_list_all(
								runas=None
								)

List all gemsets for all installed rubies.

Note that you must have set a default ruby before this can work.

Arguments

Name Description
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.gemset_list_all

get

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.get(
								version='stable',
								runas=None
								)

Update RVM.

Arguments

Name Description
version

Which version of RVM to install, e.g. stable or head.
ruby

The version of ruby to reinstall.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.get

install

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.install(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Install RVM system wide.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.install

install_ruby

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.install_ruby(
								ruby,
								runas=None
								)

Install a ruby implementation.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The version of ruby to install.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.install_ruby 1.9.3-p385

is_installed

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.is_installed(
								runas=None
								)

Details

Check if RVM is installed.

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.is_installed

list_

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.list_(
								runas=None
								)

List all rvm installed rubies.

Arguments

Name Description
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.list

reinstall_ruby

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.reinstall_ruby(
								ruby,
								runas=None
								)

Reinstall a ruby implementation.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The version of ruby to reinstall.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.reinstall_ruby 1.9.3-p385

rubygems

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.rubygems(
								ruby,
								version,
								runas=None
								)

Installs a specific rubygems version in the given ruby.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The ruby to install rubygems for.
version

The version of rubygems to install or 'remove' to use the version that ships with 1.9

runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.rubygems 2.0.0 1.8.24

set_default

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.set_default(
								ruby,
								runas=None
								)

Set the default ruby.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby

The version of ruby to make the default.
runas

The user to run rvm as.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.set_default 2.0.0

wrapper

Syntax

salt.modules.rvm.wrapper(
								ruby_string,
								wrapper_prefix,
								runas=None,
								*binaries
								)

Install RVM wrapper scripts.

Arguments

Name Description
ruby_string

Ruby/gemset to install wrappers for.
wrapper_prefix

What to prepend to the name of the generated wrapper binaries.
runas

The user to run rvm as.
binaries

The names of the binaries to create wrappers for. When nothing is given, wrappers for ruby, gem, rake, irb, rdoc, ri and testrb are generated.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' rvm.wrapper <ruby_string> <wrapper_prefix>
